Name: Persians
History: The Persian Empire, when ruled by the Achaemenid dynasty, was one of the greatest empires of antiquity, stretching at its zenith from the Indus Valley in the east to Greece in the west. The Persians were the pioneers of empire-building of the ancient world, successfully imposing a centralized rule over various peoples with different customs, laws, religions and languages, and building a cosmopolitan army made up of contingents from each of these nations.

Technologies.Name: Kardakes Reform
Technologies.History: After defeats against the Greek City-States the Persians started to form heavier units and introduce mercenaries in their armies.
Technologies.Description: Spearmen +10% attack, hit points and vision. Skirmishers +10% attack, hit points, range and vision.

Technologies.Name: Persian Architecture
Technologies.History: The Persians built the wonderful 1677 mile-long Royal Highway from Sardis to Susa; Darius the Great and Xerxes also built the magnificent Persepolis; Cyrus the Great greatly improved Ecbatana and virtually 'rebuilt' the old Elamite capital of Susa.

Heroes.Name: Anusyia
Heroes.History: Fast moving and fast trained Champion Spearman. Deals x3 damage to Cavalry and Elephants.

CivBonuses.Name: Great King's Levy
CivBonuses.History: The Persians could and did levy a large number of infantry during wartime due to the sheer size of the Achaemenid Empire and the way in which it was set-up. In general the Persian infantry was well trained and fought with great tenacity. However while this was true the infantry were poor hand-to-hand, close combat fighters. Also, with the exception of the elite regiments, the Persian infantry was not a standing professional force.

CivBonuses.Name: Light Infantry
CivBonuses.History: The majority of eastern infantrymen were hastely levied unarmored troops.
CivBonuses.Description: Levy Spear Infantry are significantly weaker, cheaper and faster to train.

CivBonuses.Name: Archery Tradition
CivBonuses.History: The Persians had a tradition of fine archery and a penchant for using massed archers in battle.
CivBonuses.Description: Infantry Archers +10% range/vision and -25% train time.

CivBonuses.Name: Naval Invasion
CivBonuses.History: The Persians, employing their skilled phoenician and other maritime subjects were among the first to large large scale naval invasions including the trasportation of cavalry.
CivBonuses.Description: Heavy Transports tech free (Merchantmen +10 transport capacity).

TeamBonuses.Name: Royal Road
TeamBonuses.History: Coinage was invented by the Lydians in 7th Century B.C., but it was not very common until the Persian period. Darius the Great standardized coined money and his golden coins (known as 'darics') became commonplace not only throughout his empire, but as far to the west as Central Europe.

Structures.Name: Apadana
Structures.Description: Adds a trickle of all resource types and researches academic techs. Replaces the Academy.
